## Main Topics

- How to read a variance-covariance matrix
- Finding the variance of linear combinations
- Properties for finding the variance of a linear combination of 2 random variables

## Very brief reminder of a linear combination

$$
Y = a_1X_1 + a_2X_2+...+a_nX_n
$$

## Variance-Covariance Matrices

$$
V=
\begin{bmatrix}
V[X_1] & \mathrm{COV}(X_1,X_2) & \cdots & \mathrm{COV}(X_1,X_n)\\
\mathrm{COV}(X_2,X_1) & V[X_2] & \cdots & \mathrm{COV}(X_2,X_n)\\
\vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots\\
\mathrm{COV}(X_n,X_1) & \mathrm{COV}(X_n,X_2) & \cdots & V[X_n]
\end{bmatrix}
$$



## Reading a Variance-Covariance Matrix

$$
V=
\begin{bmatrix}
9 & 3 & 2 & 1\\
3 & 4 & 1.5 & 0.5\\
2 & 1.5 & 49 & 7\\
1 & 0.5 & 7 & 25
\end{bmatrix}
$$




## Properties of Variance and Covariance
::: {.fragment .fade-left}
$$
V[X] = COV[X,X]
$$
:::


::: {.fragment .fade-left}
$$
COV(X,Y) = COV(Y,X)
$$
:::


## Variance of linear combinations

$$
V[Y] = \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i^2 V[X_i]
      + 2 \sum_{i<j} a_i a_j \mathrm{COV}(X_i, X_j)
$$


## Finding the variance of a linear combination

Find $V[Y]$

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Linear Combination

$$
Y = 0.1X_1 + 0.2X_2 + 0.3X_3 + 0.4X_4 
$$

### Variance-Covariance Matrix
$$
V=
\begin{bmatrix}
9 & 3 & 2 & 1\\
3 & 4 & 1.5 & 0.5\\
2 & 1.5 & 49 & 7\\
1 & 0.5 & 7 & 25
\end{bmatrix}
$$
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
$$
V[Y] = 11.115
$$
:::

## Properties for finding the variance of a linear combination of 2 random variables

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
$$
V[aX + bY] = a^2V[X] + b^2V[Y] + 2abCOV(X, Y)
$$
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
$$
V[X + Y] = V[X] + V[Y] + 2COV(X, Y)
$$
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-left}
$$
V[X - Y] = V[X] + V[Y] - 2COV(X, Y)
$$
:::
